metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a Short-term Student

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a Short-term Student

STS 1.1. A person applying for entry clearance as a Short-term Student must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form “Short-term Student visa”.

1.   STS 1.2. An application for entry clearance as a Short-term Student must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee and Immigration Health Charge must have been paid; and

2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and 
    1.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality; and
    2.   (d) the applicant must be outside the UK.

STS 1.3. The applicant must be aged 16 or over on the date of application.

STS 1.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a Short-term Student may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

### Suitability requirements for a Short-term Student

STS 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

metadata.section_title: Entry requirements for a Short-term Student

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for a Short-term Student

STS 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a Short-term Student must obtain entry clearance as a Short-term Student before they arrive in the UK.

STS 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a Short-term Student for more than 6 months must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

metadata.section_title: Course requirements for a Short-term Student

chunks.text:
### Course requirements for a Short-term Student

STS 4.1. The course provider must be an accredited institution.

STS 4.2. The applicant must provide written evidence from the course provider that the applicant has been accepted onto an English language course (that does not include any other subject) that lasts at least 6 months and no longer than 11 months.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Short-term Student (English language)
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Short-term Student (English language)
metadata.section_title: Study requirement for a Short-term Student

chunks.text:
### Study requirement for a Short-term Student

1.   STS 5.1. The applicant must satisfy the decision maker that they are a genuine Short-term Student, which means they: 
    1.   (a) are genuinely seeking entry for the purpose of undertaking the course of study for which they have demonstrated they have been accepted onto in STS 4.2; and
    2.   (b) will not study in the UK other than for the course of study for which they have demonstrated they have been accepted onto in STS 4.2; and
    3.   (c) will not study at an academy or state-funded school; and
    4.   (d) will leave the UK within 30 days of the end of their English language course, or at the end of 11 months, whichever is sooner; and
    5.   (e) will not make the UK their main home; and
    6.   (f) will not work in the UK; and
    7.   (g) will not engage in any business or professional activities in the UK; and
    8.   (h) have relied upon funds to meet the Financial Requirement in STS 6.1 to STS 6.4 which are genuinely available to them t for the purposes of undertaking the course of study for which they have demonstrated they have been accepted onto in STS 4.2.

STS 5.2. DELETED

metadata.section_title: Financial requirements for a Short-term Student

chunks.text:
### Financial requirements for a Short-term Student

STS 6.1. The applicant must be able to maintain and accommodate themselves adequately without receiving public funds.

STS 6.2. The applicant must have enough funds to meet the cost of their return or onward journey from the UK.

STS 6.3. At the date of application, the applicant must have paid their course fees or have enough funds to pay their course fees.

STS 6.4. Funds must be shown as specified in Appendix Finance.

metadata.section_title: Parental consent requirement for a Short-term Student aged 16 or 17

chunks.text:
### Parental consent requirement for a Short-term Student aged 16 or 17

STS 7.1. The applicant must meet the parental consent requirement for applicant not applying as a dependent child in Appendix Children.

STS 7.2. DELETED

metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Short-term Student (English language)
metadata.section_title: Decision on an application as a Short-term Student

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a Short-term Student

STS 8.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for a Short-term Student are met the application will be granted, otherwise the application will be refused.

STS 8.2. If the application is refused, the person can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for a Short-term Student

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for a Short-term Student

STS 9.1. The applicant will be granted permission for 11 months.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix Short-term Student (English language)
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix Short-term Student (English language)
metadata.section_title: Conditions of grant for a Short-term Student

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for a Short-term Student

1.   STS 9.2. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) no work; and
    3.   (c) study only on the course for which the applicant was granted permission.
